title: Vertically align input elements, reduce input padding, hide message IDs visually

requirements.summary: In the chat input area (MessageInput component), vertically center-align all elements — the text input field and all action buttons — so they share the same horizontal axis.
acceptanceCriteria: The text input and all buttons in the chat input bar are vertically centered on the same axis
No other layout or styling changes are introduced

file_operations.description: Update the container element that wraps the text input and action buttons to use flexbox with `items-center` (vertical centering). Ensure all child elements (text input field, send button, voice recording button, emoji button, Giphy button, and media upload button) are aligned on the same horizontal axis using consistent flex alignment properties. Do not modify any other styling or functionality.

requirements.summary: Reduce vertical padding in the chat input area (MessageInput component) to give more vertical space to the chat messages area above it.
acceptanceCriteria: The chat input area has less vertical padding than before
More vertical space is available for the messages list
No other style changes are introduced

file_operations.description: Reduce the vertical padding (py-* classes) on the MessageInput container element. Review the current padding values and decrease them to provide more space for the messages list above. Do not modify horizontal padding or any other styling properties.

requirements.summary: Visually hide message ID labels in the chat message bubbles (MessageBubble component) so they are not visible to users, while preserving their DOM presence with the correct anchor IDs so that share links and URL-based anchoring remain fully functional.
acceptanceCriteria: Message ID text is not visible in the chat UI
Each message still has its anchor element in the DOM with the correct ID attribute
Navigating to a share link scrolls to and highlights the correct message
No other style or functionality changes are introduced

file_operations.description: Apply visual hiding to the message ID text content while keeping the anchor element in the DOM. Use CSS utility classes like `sr-only` (screen-reader-only) or `opacity-0 h-0 overflow-hidden` to hide the ID text visually. Ensure the anchor element retains its `id` attribute (e.g., `id={message.messageId}`) so that URL-based navigation and scroll-to-message functionality continue to work. Do not remove the anchor element or modify any other message rendering logic.
